Package se.arkalix.security

Class X509TrustStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.security.X509TrustStore
  • public class X509TrustStore
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds x.509 certificates associated with trusted identities.
    See Also:
    RFC 5280

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      X509TrustStore​(java.security.cert.X509Certificate... certificates)
      Creates new x.509 trust store from given array of certificates.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.security.cert.X509Certificate[] certificates()  
      static X509TrustStore from​(java.security.KeyStore keyStore)
      Creates new x.509 trust store by collecting all certificates from given initialized KeyStore.
      static X509TrustStore read​(java.nio.file.Path path, char[] password)
      Reads JVM-compatible key store from specified path and collects all contained certificates into a created X509TrustStore.
      static X509TrustStore systemDefault()
      Loads default X509TrustManager from the system and uses its list of accepted issuers to initialize a new trust store.

        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • from

        public static X509TrustStore from​(java.security.KeyStore keyStore)
                           throws java.security.KeyStoreException
        Creates new x.509 trust store by collecting all certificates from given initialized KeyStore.
        Parameters:
        keyStore - Key store containing trusted certificates.
        Returns:
        New x.509 trust store.
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyStoreException - If keyStore has not been initialized.
        See Also:
        RFC 5280

      • read

        public static X509TrustStore read​(java.nio.file.Path path,
                                  char[] password)
                           throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                                  java.io.IOException
        Reads JVM-compatible key store from specified path and collects all contained certificates into a created X509TrustStore.

        As of Java 11, only the PKCS#12 key store format is mandatory to support for Java implementations.

        Parameters:
        path - Filesystem path to key store to load.
        password - Key store password, or null if not required.
        Returns:
        New x.509 trust store.
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - If the key store contains data or details that cannot be interpreted or supported properly.
        java.io.IOException - If the key store at the specified path could not be read.
        See Also:
        RFC 5280, RFC 7292

      • systemDefault

        public static X509TrustStore systemDefault()
                                    throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Loads default X509TrustManager from the system and uses its list of accepted issuers to initialize a new trust store.
        Returns:
        New x.509 trust store.
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - If loading default trust manager fails.

      • certificates

        public java.security.cert.X509Certificate[] certificates()
        Returns:
        Clone of trusted x.509 certificates.
        See Also:
        RFC 5280
